tatami.core.agent.visualization

Class AgentGuiConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.config.Config
      • tatami.core.agent.visualization.AgentGuiConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, net.xqhs.util.config.Configurable

    public class AgentGuiConfig
extends net.xqhs.util.config.Config
implements java.io.Serializable
    The class holds a configuration for the agent's GUI, which is independent of the platform the GUI will run on.

    Beside parameters such as the window's name, type, etc, the class handles the creation of the class name for the actual GUI -- deciding, based on platform and other indicators, what class extending AgentGui to load.

    While the class contains GUI settings that contain the term 'window' (name and type), which is inappropriate for some platforms (e.g. Android), those settings are of general value and can be used on other platforms as well, with similar purposes.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setClassNameOverride

        public AgentGuiConfig setClassNameOverride(java.lang.String className)
        Sets the GUI class name override. This name will be used to load the GUI, without further intervention.
        Parameters:
        className - - the fully qualified name of the class. It is expected that the class extends AgentGui.
        Returns:
        the instance itself, for chained calls.

      • setGuiClass

        public AgentGuiConfig setGuiClass(java.lang.String className,
                         java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> packages)
        Sets the class name for the GUI. The method further adjust the full name of the class depending on the platform.

        The usual scenarios for a GUI class are:

        • the decision mechanism is completely overridden, and the class name is set through setClassNameOverride(). FIXME: not completely.
        • the given className is null, and the default GUI for the platform will be considered.
        • a fully qualified name for the class is given, which will be allowed only if it is a class in the core implementation (i.e. the package of the class contains the default GUI path.
        • a name is given, that can be found in the collection of packages in the second parameter, under the name of the current platform. E.g. for the name MyGui and packages containing my_package, on an Android platform, the searched class will be my_package.android.MyGui
        Parameters:
        className - - the class for the GUI.
        packages - - a Collection of packages into which to look for the class.
        Returns:
        the instance itself, for chained calls.
